Post title: Moodle for more than one class?
Post description: I teach three different social studies classes. How can I set up a seperate moodle page for each one? My school controls the Admin. rights to moodle, so they had to set me up...I just can't get multiple courses set.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: It would be helpful to have some additional information and explanation. What do you mean by "I just can't get multiple courses set?" What do you mean by "Moodle page"? Have you read the docs on Moodle courses? Why don't you ask the admin to make you a course creator (you can search in the docs regarding the coursecreator role) so that you can create your own courses. If all three classes are the same course you may want to look at using groupings within one course (see docs for info on groups and groupings) This way you would only have to really manage one class vis-a-vis assignments etc, while being able to group students by what one might call sections (at least that was the language used at university back when I was going to classes
Comment 2: Hi Marc, Are you wanting to use the same course for each class but keep assignments forums grades etc separate, in which case use groups.Each clas is a separate group within the same course. Hope this helps greg

Forum Post: 
Post title: Back-date Course Completion
Post description: Happy Wednesday!! I see a lot of red flags with this request, however, I need to ask..... Is there a way to back-date/select your own completion date for a course? For instance, users take offline training on Sept 1st, however, the teacher doesn't go into the course and mark completion until Sept 5th.  The users completion and certificate will show Sept 5th instead of Sept 1st.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Nobody can offer any comment on this?????
Comment 2: The only way I can see to achieve this would be to write a local plugin that adjusts that completion date directly in the database . Not all completion is marked based on teacher input - completion may be automatic based on user activity, so I don't think there would be one place (currently) to create a setting such as adding your own completion date. Also agree re 'red flags', especially around "select your own completion date for a course" - I think such ability would need to be severely restricted and certainly should not be up to the user to select their own completion date for a course!
Comment 3: Thank you so much Richard for your reply. You have pretty much confirmed what I was thinking but needed to hear from someone else before presenting to our user group. Have a great day!
Comment 4: Hi Jackie, Just thinking outside the box for a minute here, if you don't mind. First of all, what certificate module are you using? Workplace's Course Certificate or some of the other alternatives? If you're using the WP one, can't you just set other 'Date' fields in the certificate template to reflect the start or end date of the workshop? It's also not really uncommon to have a signoff date on the certificate that's after the actual workshop event took place.
Comment 5: Happy Wednesday, Joost. Thank you for your reply and 'thinking out of the box' idea. We are using the standard WP course certificate. I didn't think any of the other date options for the certificate fit my need but I will take a second look. Basically, we need to enter a date for the certificate. None of the variables that I saw available allowed that - they picked up the sign-off date, the start date, etc. That is not what we want. Basically, we need to set the completion date when marking the activities complete. If you have anymore 'out of the box' ideas, please post them. Have a wonderful day!
Comment 6: Let me rephrase what I posted above as what we need. We need to be able manually set activity completion so that the date of the off-line training appears on the course certificate. As stated in my original post, student takes off-line course on Sept 1, however, teach doesn't start marking completion in Moodle until Sept 5. We want the course certificate to reflect Sept 1 as the course completion date.
Comment 7: If the offline course is set up as an event, can't you use the event date in the certificate? That way, your certificate could state 'The offline training event took place on Sept 1', signed by teach on Sept 5.
Comment 8: Happy Thursday, Joost!!! Again, some very good ideas! Thank you!!

Post title: How to duplicate course content
Post description: Hi.  I'm new to the forum and wonder if anyone can help.  I have built a Moodle learning room with one complete course for a group of students (group 01).  The course has seven modules and each module has its own set of course notes with release dates, which I've uploaded successfully.  I have also saved the course notes to my private files within the learning room. I will be delivering this course to five different groups and each group will start and finish their course at a slightly later time, so every group will be getting their materials on timed release at different times. Now that I've built Group 01's course, is there an efficient way for me to set up the courses for Groups 2, 3, 4 and 5 and migrate the entire content from 01 to 02, 03, 04 and 05?  That would only leave me with the need to enrol the students onto their course and change the release dates. I want to avoid having to manually upload the materials 28 more times. Thank you, Andrew
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Andrew A backup and restore without user data (into a new course shell) sounds like what you may want to do.
Comment 2: Kim, you are a star!  Thank you so much, I've done it with your help.  You have saved me hours, and taught me something new.  Andrew

Forum Post: 
Post title: Manager Roles and Perscribed Learning work-around?
Post description: I develop eLearning at a corporate office that supports our franchise network of 700 users. There are 70 franchisees with about 10 employees per location and I would like to have the following capability for the "franchisee admin." I didn't see anything where I can associate a manager to students... is there such a thing out there? The following is my best case scenario for a user hierarchy: For example: I build all of the eLearning that is distributed to our 70 locations. I build 70 location admins that are responsible for managing users at each location. Each admin can only see users built at thier location. Each franchise admin can assign training / view reports on all employees at the location The corporate administrator can run reports for all users at each location Please let me know if this is possible.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi Greg, The closest thing I've used to this would be setting up a mentor (parent) role (find out more at http://docs.moodle.org/en/Parent_role ). I did this so that I could assign a manager to a number of employees who could monitor their team's progress (or lack thereof). This doesn't address the issue of being able to assign training at franchise level, but with a bit of tweaking in the roles (as you'll see when you go to set up a mentor/mentee relationship) you should be able to work something out. Hope this helps, Mark.
Comment 2: Hi Greg. In part the answer depends on the version of Moodle you are using. In earlier versions of Moodle, you could add a manager as a non-editing teacher, and assign them to a group. I believe in older versions of Moodle if a non-editing teacher is assinged to a group in separate groups mode, they can't see the other groups. Alternatively, you could make each location a course and assign the local admin as a teacher on that course.

Forum Post: 
Post title: Completion rules and quiz - baffled!
Post description: Hi there I set up a completion rule for a Moodle quiz that students must receive a passing mark. I then set up a restriction that students could see something unless they had completed the quiz and received a passing mark.  It didn't work. I had to change the restriction to a grade restriction in order for it to work. Why did I have to do this? Thanks KerryJ
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Probably this is what you need... First, set a grade to pass in the gradebook.  Grades->Setup-> Edit->Edit Settings for the quiz.  Change the grade to pass to the number of points required for passing (might have to click show more to see it in settings).  I emphasize number of points because I've had instructors with 20 point quizzes put 70 in instead of 14, indicating 70% to pass and no one can get credit and everyone is confused.  Save. Then in the quiz settings, check both must receive a passing grade AND must receive a grade.  If the receive a grade isn't checked, it won't work.  Don't know why, just this is how I resolved a similar issue.

Post title: Question type: put word at the right place without showing gaps
Post description: Hi, I want to give an expression and a word to place inside the expression. 
```text
Place the word at the right place in the sentence


This is a cat (black)
```
 The student should be able to place the word anywhere, but only one place is the correct one. (The drag and drop in text question type shows the correct place, and use words as false answers. I want the opposite: the word is always the correct one, but the place to put it is hidden) Regards
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: From what I've seen so far, Drag and Drop text questions in Moodle(including H5P content type) does not have this feature. This can however, be developed.
Comment 2: Maybe jmix exercise in Hot Potatoes would suit your idea. see https://hotpot.uvic.ca/wintutor7/jmix1.htm To make this in Moodle, use version 6 of the Hot Potatoes software, plus the HotPot plugin .
Comment 3: In case you can do with copy/paste instead of drag and drop, you could use essay autograde to achieve what you want. https://moodle.org/plugins/?q=autograde
Comment 4: I feel a new question type, anyone got some money and time?
Comment 5: I made a mockup, with the excellent Gapfill question and some CSS , of what such a question might look like. You can try it at Insert word . Drag the word "black" onto the sentence and click Check. Note that the question behaviour is set to Adaptive mode (all or nothing).
Comment 6: Dominique you are a wizard. I fell asleep last night thinking about how it might be done. In an entirely new question type there would be a hidden field at the end of every word (text without white space) and there would be an option to either drag/drop or click to select, click to place.
Comment 7: Hi Dominique Very nicely done! 👍 It looks nice with your CSS: really does the magic. (I really need to ask my schools to add the gapfill qtype) Thanks

Forum Post: 
Post title: Same course different prices?
Post description: Hi All, I am fairly new to Moodle and need help trying to set up the same class with two different prices. Example unergrads and grads share a couple of the same courses but the cost would be different for each. How do I set up the same class so all students are in there together yet have them paying the different prices. I have done some research on meta courses but I'm not sure that is my answer.
Comments associated with the post: 
Comment 1: Hi, I don´t know if it's what you want, but here is the idea: You duplicate the courses, changing a little the name and the short name, so you put one price in each course, with the same students, the meta course idea is good, you can try it.
Comment 2: The metacourse would allow you to keep only one set (copy) of the materials. You set up two courses, one for undergrads and another for grads, each with a different price, then make a metacourse with those two courses as its children. In each of the children courses, you place a link to the metacourse as the place where working materials etc are. The side benefit could be that you can also provide stuff which is specific for each group without other group knowing about it. Note that this question is more an enrollment issue than a teaching strategy, so it really belongs in the enrollment forum, although I can see how it could be considered a teaching strategy issue as well.
